title: Vinted Introduces Verification Service for Luxury Designer Fashion, Promoting Sustainable Shopping
originSummary: Vinted, an online marketplace, has introduced a verification service for luxury fashion items to enhance user confidence in purchasing secondhand designer pieces.
The service, conducted by a team of experts, costs £10 per item priced at £100 or above, ensuring the authenticity of the products.

Vinted's initiative aims to encourage circular shopping and reduce the environmental impact of the fashion industry, while emphasizing the need to care for items and retain proof of authenticity for successful secondhand designer shopping.

title: Alibaba Cloud outage disrupts Taobao and other apps for the second time in a year
originSummary: Alibaba Cloud, the cloud computing unit of Alibaba, suffered a system failure causing the suspension of services for Taobao and other popular apps.
This is the second major outage for Alibaba Cloud in less than a year, raising concerns about its reliability as a computing infrastructure provider for AI applications.
The outage affected other Alibaba apps and cloud storage services, but the company managed to restore all services within 3.5 hours.

title: Buyer Beware: Limited Protection for Purchases on Facebook Marketplace
originSummary: Facebook Marketplace lacks the same level of buyer protection as traditional e-commerce platforms.
Users face risks such as fraud, item misrepresentation, and safety concerns during in-person transactions.
Buyers should protect themselves by researching sellers, maintaining open communication, and being cautious of deals that appear too good to be true.

title: Judge Jay-Jay recommends cost-saving options for dental work and appliance replacement
originSummary: Helen seeks advice from radio personality Jay-Jay Feeney regarding whether to replace her missing tooth or buy a new dishwasher.
Jay-Jay advises Helen to research cheaper dentistry options and payment plans for the tooth replacement.
For the dishwasher, Jay-Jay suggests looking for second-hand options or discounted appliances.

title: Alibaba Cloud service failure impacts Taobao shopping app post Singles' Day, second outage in a year
originSummary: Alibaba Cloud, the cloud computing unit of Alibaba Group Holding, experienced a service failure causing the suspension of its shopping app Taobao and other major Alibaba apps.
This is the second significant system failure for the company in less than a year, impacting popular apps including DingTalk and Xianyu.
The outage occurred just after the annual Singles' Day shopping event and lasted approximately three and a half hours before all services were restored.
